column5: Just to interject the other end of the spectrum, the most primitive I've ever encountered was on a fly in lake called Ramsey, out of Gogama. Just a platform with a toilet seat. No walls, out in the middle of nowhere. Had to take the paper with you from the cabin. One step ahead of the old scouting cat scratch.

I can't take credit for this but this is on the Wine Lake Website. Yes they have a dual outhouse with a checkerboard in it, cartoons on the wall and magazine racks. Enjoy the songhttp://winelakecamp.com/song.mp3

Fly in lake with small outhouse with flush toilet. Door swung open for a great view of lake...very quiet lake, privacy not an issue....hope the flush went into a leech field and not the lake....I'm sure it did...
you gotta love that checkerboard in the two holer - now that's original. speed checkers anyone? phish
at north caribou lake - pickle lake outposts. phish
ok - I think I found the best bush outhouse in Ontario - see:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G6imXjL9yWo any competitors? phish

Here is the Cadillac of outhouses at Black Bear Lodge on Red Lake. This is the men's facility. The ladies have their own facility. Out house and general sinks on the left side of the building, shower house on the right side of the building.https://www.walleyecentral.com/forums...ictureid=32129https://www.walleyecentral.com/forums...ictureid=32553https://www.walleyecentral.com/forums...ictureid=32545 PjShorthorn
quite impressive - is the flush as quite as my entry?? phish
About as quiet as a fart in the woods by a bear...... PjShorthorn

This is a private owned outhouse in N. Minnesota but I swear this is the best outhouse I've ever seen. Comes complete with electricity and a wood stove. Yeah, I know, it's not a Canadian bush camp outhouse like the thread states but I had to put this here. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=adkNNbinnEY
I built a pretty nice one at my camp in NW Quebec. Boardwalk leading to it just off the deck. It's lined with cedar, has a tiled floor, and it's actually a flush toilet. The womenfolk approve.
Hey Mike, what do your women folk think about that glass door???????? LOL I would imagine the men like it also.
I would expect to see a thread like this in winter! My vote is for Black Bear Lodge! Started many a good day there!
It's frosted glass, all you see is a blurry outline. Better than being cramped in a tiny dark claustrophobic shack. From inside the blurry view is stellar.
So you have been peeping ? It is quite the washroom, but I bet you don't have premium TP like this kind. PjShorthorn
